text: I'm trying to figure out witch plot they are basing this off of. I saw a lot of scenes straight from the 1st movie, 2 scenes straight from the 2nd movie, and plot points in the dialogue that sounded like they came from the 2nd season as well as a few that looked like they just came up with them completely on their own.  Now, the 1st movie had just about no plot. It was pretty much just an excuse for some beautiful visuals and some fan service. The 1st season had a wonderful plot and was the best story writing of the entire series. It does not look from this trailer like they are using any of that though. The 2nd season went a lot into the back-story of a lot of the characters.  So, here is my theory based on this trailer. I think that they are probably taking a lot of scenes directly from the 1st movie because it was such good visuals, but using a plot more similar to the 2nd movie witch actually had a freaking plot unlike the 1st. Meanwhile, they use the actual back-story from the 2nd season and come up with their own villain plot to fit in to it. Overall, I would say this concept definitely has potential. Enough to please the fans, but also give their writers creative license to come up with something interesting. I was not interested in seeing this movie before, but this trailer and actually thinking about those points might have actually convinced me.

text: I'll admit I've only recently seen the first Ghost in the Shell(I'll be checking out the other related media, soon. Promise. :) ) and I loved that movie. This looks fairly decent, Scarlett Johansson, despite my reservations, seems decent int he role. And I love how the cinematography matches the movie in that grity realism. The question will be nailing the characters and the deep themes.   Because, what I loved about the first movie was its handling of philosophical themes. They felt natural and were woven into the narrative and characterization. And let me tell you; that's really hard to do. Because, you either end up with characters that are talking heads(cough, Urabachi. I don't hate him. I think he's overrated) or where it comes off utterly pretentious(cough, BVS. Not that I hate Snyder, as well.). Overall, I'm looking forward to seeing this now. I just hope it can deliver and finally break the curse of anime adaptation movies sucking.   Though, Edge of Tomorrow kind of does, but that was a Light Novel. Very different.
